definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to accuse wrongly/to treat unjustly/injustice/wronged/not worthwhile
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
see 徇私枉法[xun4 si1 wang3 fa3]
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
one who doesn't avenge an injustice is not a gentleman, one who doesn't redress a wrong is not a man (idiom)
pinyin: you3 chou2 bu4 bao4 fei1 jun1 zi3 , you3 yuan1 bu4 shen1 wang3 wei2 ren2
containing_words.word: 有仇不报非君子，有冤不伸枉为人

sentences.english: Tis alby oneself vain to learn wisdom or yet live foolishly.
sentences.chinese: 枉自己好好复习智慧，却做愚蠢事。

sentences.english: Love looks like water passing east, foolishly poured in vain.
sentences.chinese: 情像水向东逝去，痴心枉倾注。

sentences.english: This is an apple tree, and those is an orange tree.
sentences.chinese: 这是一棵苹果树，那是一棵桔子枉。

sentences.english: If the send-off with the South, in vain is the bayberry G Lang Yi.
sentences.chinese: 若为寄与江南客，枉是杨梅忆庚郎。

sentences.english: Cicada without some trouble, people naturally worry in vain heartbroken.
sentences.chinese: 蝉声无一些烦恼，自是愁人枉断肠。

sentences.english: This altogether vain to learn wisdom and yet live foolishly .
sentences.chinese: 枉自学聪明，却做愚蠢事。

sentences.english: I have made up my mind. Don't waste your breath trying to persuade me.
sentences.chinese: 我主意已定，你不要枉费口舌劝我啦。

definition: to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
to be ashamed to face (sb)/to feel bad about having failed (sb)
(archaic) we/us/(Internet slang) (substitute for 我肏[wo3 cao4]) fuck/WTF
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
